ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a we lefùɔ se Peka míŋ Lemaliya, á Ésàlayɛ, Akaze míŋ Yotam cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ pà Yúndà.
en: In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah,   Ahaz  # 16:1 Is 1:1; 7:1 son of Jotham became king of Judah.

ngiemboon: Akaze la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, ńgẅiin ngùʼ móm mbʉ́a, ńnéŋe Yelúzálèm, ésáʼa láʼa Yúndà ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ né legém, tá ńké te gÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé ye páʼ tá we fùɔ Ndavîd wɔ́.
en: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was right in the sight of the Lord his God like his ancestor David

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á ké ḿbí pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ tepòŋ ye mefùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ; éfʉʼʉ fʉʼʉ tà ńdɔgɔ míŋ we ńnuŋe pwɔʼ. Ńgÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ḿbíi fʉ̀ʼ mentʉ̀ menò tepòŋ mie pʉ̀a pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ńjwoŋo wɔ́b tá ńnyé jʉʼ mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, é lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo.
en: but walked in the ways of the kings of Israel.   He even sacrificed his son in the fire,  # 16:3 Lit even made his son pass through the fire imitating the detestable practices of the nations the Lord had dispossessed before the Israelites.  # 16:3 Dt 18:10; 2Kg 21:6; 2Ch 33:6

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńnuŋe shúm pwɔʼ, ḿbiŋe ńtuɔ lìi á mejʉʼʉ ssé, mbɔɔ ndùm mekwɔʼɔ́, ńgÿo metsìŋe metÿǒ ntsèm mie é sẅéte.
en: He sacrificed and burned incense   on the high places, on the hills, and under every green tree.  # 16:4 Dt 12:2

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Letsîŋ fùɔ pʉ̀a Sili pɔ́ Peka míŋ Lemaliya gẅie aa fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ, é gʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ Akaze lé ncù, ḿbú ńtíʼi Yelúzálèm, tá pɔ́ te kuʼu léjÿó ncù wɔ́.
en: Then   Aram’s King Rezin and Israel’s King Pekah son of Remaliah came to wage war against Jerusalem. They besieged Ahaz but were not able to conquer him.  # 16:5 2Kg 15:37; Is 7:1

ngiemboon: Á fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, Letsîŋ gẅie aa fùɔ pà Sili gÿo epʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ Elad zẅíŋ ntÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Alam. Ńjwoŋ pʉ̀a Yúndà; epʉ̀a Éndɔ̀m tó ńnéŋe Elad, áa jʉʼ gie pɔ́ ée ńtsẅé pɔ́ wó tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: At that time Aram’s King Rezin recovered Elath for Aram and expelled the Judahites from Elath.   Then the Arameans came to Elath, and they still live there today.  # 16:6 2Ch 26:2

ngiemboon: Akaze túm memántúm mbwó Tingelad-Falasaa fùɔ pà Asili, ńgɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «Mèŋ n gee nkwɔɔn jù, ńgwɔ́ míŋ gù. Tóo ńkẅé wɔ́ɔn mbwó fùɔ pʉ̀a Sili pɔ́ fùɔ Ésàlayɛ pie é lǔ ssé ńne ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn.»
en: So Ahaz sent messengers   to King Tiglath-pileser  # 16:7 2Kg 15:29; 1Ch 5:26 of Assyria, saying, “I am your servant and your son. March up and save me from the grasp of the king of Aram and of the king of Israel, who are rising up against me.”

ngiemboon: Akaze gɔɔn púʼu, ńcúʼte nkáb mbɔɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á laa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ shúm fùʼ sie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó fùɔ Asili, páʼ mmó nanǎ.
en: Ahaz also took the silver and gold found in the Lord’s temple and in the treasuries of the king’s palace and sent them to the king of Assyria as a bribe.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ pà Asili júʼ ncwò wé, ńgʉa ńkeme Ndamásè lé ncù, ńjÿó, ńdɔg pʉ̀a láʼ ńgʉa né Kîi, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mé zẅé Letsîŋ.
en: So the king of Assyria listened to him   and marched up to Damascus and captured it.  # 16:9 Am 1:3–5 He deported its people to Kir  # 16:9 Is 22:6; Am 9:7 but put Rezin to death.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Akaze gʉa né Ndamásè légyá Tingelad-Falasaa, fùɔ pà Asili. Ńkúu Ndamásè ńgyá jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńkaa jʉ́jʉ́ŋ pâ mefʉ̀ʼ mɛ̌ ntsèm, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó Ulia nùŋepwɔʼ, á Yelúzálèm.
en: King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet King Tiglath-pileser   of Assyria. When he saw the altar that was in Damascus, King Ahaz sent a model of the altar and complete plans for its construction to the priest Uriah.  # 16:10 Is 8:2

ngiemboon: Ulia, nùŋepwɔʼ la pí fʉ̀ʼ na lenuŋé pwɔʼ sie Akaze la fó Ndamásè ńtúm ńná né yé, ńkwɛ́ pɔ́ kwaʼ púʼu. À la kwɛ́ tà fùɔ Akaze gwaa fó Ndamásè piŋ, mbà à kwɛ̌ tà mag.
en: Uriah built the altar according to all the instructions King Ahaz sent from Damascus. Therefore, by the time King Ahaz came back from Damascus, the priest Uriah had completed it.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ fó Ndamásè ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńgʉa ńkwɔ́ʼ ńtyé ndùm wó,
en: When the king came back from Damascus, he saw the altar. Then he approached the altar   and ascended it.  # 16:12 Or and offered on it:

ngiemboon: kwàʼ yé máŋwɛ́ nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ shúm ntsentse, ḿbiŋ ńzá metse nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè á ndùm lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: He offered his burnt offering   and his grain offering, poured out his drink offering, and splattered the blood of his fellowship offerings  # 16:13 Lv 7:11–21 on the altar.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na lenuŋé pwɔʼ se tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ sie é laa mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà à la fó jʉʼ gie é tyé wó, á ncwò ndá, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ lenuŋé pwɔʼ se sẅé pɔ́ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńkaa ńtÿɔ́gɔ ngʉ̀ŋe lenuŋé pwɔʼ se sẅé, á gÿo mé tÿɔ́gɔ nzèm lenuŋé pwɔʼ se sẅé á shÿó kwóŋ mbyěnèm.
en: He took the bronze altar   that was before the Lord in front of the temple between his altar and the Lord’s temple, and put it on the north side of his altar.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Akaze la gÿo púʼu, ńtsẅi né Ulia nùŋepwɔʼ ngie: «Gÿo mé gʉa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńtuɔ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm ye mbaʼámbaʼ, ńtuɔ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm ye ncwònzém, ńtuɔ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm ye fùɔ, mbɔɔ yé mmó pwɔʼ shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, tuɔ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm ye pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ntsèm, ńnuŋe yɔ́b mmó pwɔʼ shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, ńzate metse shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńdɔg ńnuŋe wɔ́b pwɔʼ ntse ntse. Ńgʉa na lenuŋé pwɔʼ se tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, mbà n ge líe nò ńnáa mǒ.
en: Then King Ahaz commanded the priest Uriah, “Offer on the great altar the morning burnt offering, the evening grain offering, and the king’s burnt offering and his grain offering. Also offer the burnt offering of all the people of the land, their grain offering, and their drink offerings. Splatter on the altar all the blood of the burnt offering and all the blood of sacrifice. The bronze altar will be for me to seek guidance.”

ngiemboon: Ulia nùŋepwɔʼ gÿo kwaʼ páʼ fùɔ Akaze gɔ̌ɔn né yé.»
en: The priest Uriah did everything King Ahaz commanded.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Akaze la gíŋ ńgÿo mé záʼte mepàg tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, ńzáʼte mekélêg me ndá Ssé, ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ mmó ńkaa mengwʉ̌ŋ mie ée ndùm mekélêg. À la kaa máamáa ngwʉ̌ŋ gẅie é lezemé lézéme ńtyé ndùm mefòŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte, ńtÿɔ́gɔ ssé na metǒon mie mé la lɔg ńnyɛte jʉʼ.
en: Then King Ahaz cut off the frames of the water carts  ,# 16:17 1Kg 7:27–28 and removed the bronze basin from each of them. He took the basin  # 16:17 Lit sea,# 16:17 1Kg 7:23–25 from the bronze oxen that were under it and put it on a stone pavement.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ pà Asili zɔ la gÿo tà fùɔ Akaze gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńkúbe ncwò kɔ̀ʼ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse gie mé la kwɛ́ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá pɔ́ gie mé la kwɛ́ɛ ncwò nkáʼa nɔʼ á na nzème pǐ.
en: To satisfy the king of Assyria, he removed from the Lord’s temple the Sabbath canopy they had built in the palace, and he closed the outer entrance for the king.

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ píte menò Akaze, anò na mmó ntsèm gie à la gÿo, áa ye ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne mezẅìŋe menò mefùɔ pà Yúndà.
en: The rest   of the events of Ahaz’s reign, along with his accomplishments, are written in the Historical Record of Judah’s Kings.  # 16:19 2Kg 15:36

ngiemboon: Akaze la kwé, mé túŋo yé jʉʼ gie mé la túŋ metá pe wó, á jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd. Míŋ we Ezekiyásè wembàŋa jÿó ndá yé, ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ.
en: Ahaz rested with his ancestors   and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David, and his son Hezekiah became king in his place.
